body:
Aris,

I apologize that this fell through the cracks for almost a year but I finally remembered to implement it:

[https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/commit/fe8fb38e97dd1551...](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/commit/fe8fb38e97dd1551f101e72b4ecbcc302966faab)

This is going to be much easier to explain to people now and I updated the description in the component as follows:

The units for shade desirability are degree-days, which are essentially the amount of time in days that sun is blocked by a given cell multiplied by the degrees above (or below) the _balanceTemperature during that time.  So, if a given square meter of _testShade has a shade desirability of 10 degree-days, this means that a shade in this location provides roughly 1 day of sun protection from conditions 10 degrees Celsius warmer than the balanceTemperature_ to 1 square meter of _testRegion.



Thanks again for suggesting this.

-Chris
